Title: Discover and finalize migration scope and constraints for Customer Loyalty DB
Description: Gather all missing information required to design and execute the migration. This includes confirming the specific on-prem SQL engine and version, database size and growth characteristics, acceptable downtime/RPO/RTO, regulatory/compliance requirements, preferred cloud provider(s) and region(s), network constraints, and the new mobile app's integration and performance requirements. Deliverables: requirements questionnaire completed with application and infra owners, inventory of database objects, data size and growth report, list of stakeholders and sign-off on acceptance criteria for migration.
Acceptance Criteria:
- A completed requirements questionnaire signed by DB and app owners
- Identification of SQL engine (e.g., SQL Server/Postgres), exact version and edition
- Measured database sizes (data, log, backups) and growth metrics documented
- Agreed RPO, RTO, maintenance windows, and acceptable downtime documented and approved
- Clear target cloud preference(s) and candidate regions documented
- Documented access pattern and performance SLA requirements from the mobile app team
- Stakeholder sign-off recorded and next-step decision points defined

Title: Design target cloud architecture and security model for Customer Loyalty DB
Description: Create a target architecture for the Customer Loyalty database in the cloud based on discovered constraints. Evaluate options (managed PaaS DB, IaaS VM, or re-platform) and recommend a target service, instance sizing, high-availability pattern, backup/DR approach, network topology (VNet/subnet, peering, VPN/ExpressRoute), and security controls (authentication, encryption at rest/in transit, key management, firewall, least-privilege access). Produce architecture diagrams, cost estimates, and a security control checklist aligned to compliance requirements.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Evaluation document showing recommended target (PaaS vs IaaS vs other) with rationale and cost estimate
- Architecture diagram(s) showing network, DB HA/DR, backups, and connectivity to mobile-backend/API layer
- Security design covering authentication (managed identities/AD), encryption, key management, network ACLs, and monitoring/logging
- List of required cloud resources and estimated sizing/costs
- Risk register with mitigation steps for major design risks (data leakage, downtime, migration complexity)
- Architecture and security artifacts reviewed and approved by Solutions Architect and Security team

Title: Create detailed migration plan, runbook, and validation tests
Description: Develop a step-by-step migration plan based on the selected architecture and migration approach (e.g., backup/restore, replication, DMS). The plan must include pre-migration checks, migration steps, cutover procedure, rollback plan, validation and data integrity checks, performance testing plan, timeline with maintenance windows, and required automation scripts. Produce a runbook for ops to execute the migration and a test suite to validate data correctness and application functionality post-migration.
Acceptance Criteria:
- A migration runbook containing pre-checks, exact commands/scripts, roles & responsibilities, and cutover/rollback steps
- Automated scripts or documented manual steps to perform migration and validate data integrity
- A test plan with defined test cases for functional, data integrity, and performance validation (including mobile app integration tests)
- Schedule with proposed cutover window and communication plan for stakeholders
- Rollback plan validated with a dry run or tabletop exercise documented
- Migration plan reviewed and signed off by DB, App, and Operations teams

Title: Implement secure connectivity and API/back-end integration for mobile app
Description: Implement and validate the integration pattern for the new mobile app to access Customer Loyalty data via a secure backend/API layer (do not allow direct DB connections from mobile). Include API gateway, authentication/authorization (OAuth2/OpenID Connect), rate limiting, TLS, and monitoring. Validate end-to-end flows with the mobile app: authentication, common read/write operations, and expected performance under peak load. Provide configuration and runbooks for secure access and operational monitoring.
Acceptance Criteria:
- A backend/API design implemented that provides mobile app access to required DB functionality (no direct DB connections)
- Authentication and authorization implemented (e.g., OAuth2 / managed identities) and tested
- TLS enforced end-to-end and network paths secured (firewalls, private endpoints)
- Load/performance test results demonstrating the integration meets agreed mobile SLA under expected load
- Logging, metrics, and alerting configured for API and DB access (retention and access controls documented)
- Integration tests executed and passed by mobile app team, with defects tracked and resolved
